title: Professional and friendly practice
body:
Appointment on time - no waiting.
Dealt with professionally and thoroughly in a friendly manner. Very pleasant experience.

title: Outstanding Professionals
body: I have visited the department for nuclear medicine twice for investigative purposes to aid diagnosis. The team in this department are exceptional in their concern for patients and thoroughly professional. On my recent visit towards the end of June, the staff treated me with respect and explained all the procedures in detail despite the issues around COVID-19 and the busy schedule. I praised the staff on the day but such dedication deserves a wider audience - including NHS management. An excellent team representing the NHS at its best. I even received a courtesy call afterwards to indicate further investigation was not warranted at this time. A thoughtful and reassuring call. Thank you for everything.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Great practice
body: I have been at this practice for 25 years now and have nothing but good to say. My GP is amazing and as well as being highly professional has always gone out of his way to explain, advise and offer reassurance. The staff have always been helpful and friendly and I have never, ever had to wait longer than expected to be seen. The whole Covid vaccination process was so well organised and executed. I was literally in and out on both occasions. The surgery is a credit to all those that are part of it and to the NHS. Thank you for everything you have ever done for me and my family over the years.

title: Outstanding Care
body: I cannot praise the care I received at the Meriden enough, I felt very safe with all the Covid safe measures they have in place.  All the staff I received care from were caring, compassionate, respectful and helpful, nothing was too much trouble.  I have no hesitation in recommending the BMI Meriden for any treatment.

title: Culture of kindness
body: I would like to thank the team of dedicated staff on Overton ward. My mother has just spent two weeks in the care of these wonderful people. She has been happy and received all the medical care required for her recovery. Most importantly of all she has received kindness. This is truly good medicine at its best. Well done all and huge thanks from our family.

title: Fantastic service
body: I am so so please I moved to wootton surgery a few years  ago, the service is amazing. I have received top patient care. For the first time in many years I have found a gp who listens and has worked with me to achieve out standing results. Thank you to all staff

title: Grateful for help
body:
I have had to contact the surgery quite a lot recently regarding my physical and mental health. I contact the surgery mostly by Footfall or by telephone. The admin/reception team and clinicians are all very polite and helpful, they are very responsive too in a very good timeframe. 

Thank you and please know that your work throughout this pandemic and even before is appreciated.

title: Brilliant Team
body:
I would just like to comment on how fantastic this team are:

Throughout this Pandemic they have continued to provide brilliant care towards us all and remained resolute throughout.

I would also like to comment on the politeness of the newest receptionist...lovely girl and a credit to the practise.

A big well done and thank you to you all

title: Ward 8 needs improvement.
body: I visited ward 8 at RPH after being transfered from A&E. Triage was fast and the staff in the observation bays are extremely attentive and knowledgeable. My child was admitted with breathing difficulties and was told we needed oxygen for them, we were kept on the observation ward initially to look at his oxygen stats prior to transfer, observations being done every hour and if the oxygen monitor bleeped staff were prompt to check on my child. Being transfered to the actual ward is where my care went rapidly downhill. I was told by staff on the triage was that once I got onto the ward staff would monitor my child administering oxygen as and when required. Once transfered to the ward in the middle of the night I was left with my child attached to the monitor, for it to bleep for over an hour before I had to press the buzzer for the staff nurse to come and check my child's observations. This was reoccurrence throughout the night where no staff came to the monitor bleeping, most nurses sat around the nurse station having a good laugh and joke and ignoring all monitors bleeping. I am not medically trained but felt I needed to be to make decisions around oxygen for my child's care due to the lack of support from the nurses on the ward. Support needs to be given rather than nurses expecting the parent to know whats best.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very friendly
body: Went in for some scans. Everyone and I mean everyone were fantastic from start to finish. Nurses and doctors remembering me and were so kind. In every department. Was kept well informed and reassured flawlessly. Thankyou again.

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body:
Excellent patient service, GP’s provide high standards with care very supportive and maintaining dignity and respect 
Reception staff always helpful kind and respectful

title: Excellent care & communication
body: My partner & I were so impressed & immensely thankful with the treatment our toddler received from the staff in the A & E department & on the children’s ward... They communicated with us every step of the way & were extremely caring, considerate & consistent throughout our short stay. As parents the comforting feeling knowing our son was receiving such great care was priceless. Thank you so much to all the staff for your hard work & overall compassion... true angels 😇

title: Very good practice
body:
I have been with this practice since 1970, had no problems at all, if you are polite, then they will be polite to you.
Very professional staff and medical team, everyone is under strain during this pandemic so patience is the key word. 
We can all have bad days at work but they are always polite.

title: Top quality treatment and care in a very busy A &…
body: received excellent, thorough treatment on what was a very busy day in A&E.  Although my visit took five hours I didn't mind because I felt that I had an extremely thorough examination and that all aspects of my illness were looked into to achieve a full and precise diagnosis at the end.  Heartfelt thanks to staff who have just gone through such a demanding period with the pandemic but still continued to be professional, care and maintain such high standards

title: Fantastic service
body: I have been coming to The Walk in Clinic for dressings for the past week. I cannot fault the service and care that I have been receiving. The reception staff are fantastic very friendly and welcoming especially the two receptionists that were on the front desk this morning Saturday 10th July. Well done receptionists you are doing a brilliant job and it is much appreciated.

title: Excellent practice
body: All staff were welcoming, pleasant and super professional and efficient. I was impressed at how organised they were and yet so friendly. Lovely place and lovely people!

title: Amazing service at a marvellous practice.
body: My wife and l have lived in Muxton for the last fourteen years and previous to that in many different areas of England. I have to say that l have never known a surgery that does so much to satisfy their patients needs both at Muxton and Newport. Five years ago l was diagnosed with an abdominal aortic aneurysm and Newport surgery found it, arranged surgery at the hospital and looked after me after the procedure. Six weeks ago l went to Newport surgery with a lump on my one tonsil, it had only been there a week but when the doctor who l had not been to previously saw it he remarked that it looked a little sinister and referred me to the head and neck dept at the Princess Royal. Within days l had C Scan and MRI scans and my treatment was started.. l had a pan endoscopy and tonsillectomy and two weeks later after more investigations laser treatment to cut out the cancer. I consider the doctors saved my life at Linden Hall and l will always be grateful to them. We have recommended them to friends and neighbours who are also very happy to be using them.

title: Great Practice
body:
I have been a patient at this Practice for over 40 years and have always found the Doctors and all the reception staff to be extremely helpful and friendly and take the time to listen and go the extra mile. Thank you all very much.
Posted July 2021

title: Great practice
body: I cannot fault the treatment I received at this practice during my recent treatment for an ear virus and Bell's Palsy which resulted in 4 days in hospital in Winchester.  I received a high grade of professional help from the doctors - both on the telephone and face-to-face, as well as kind, courteous and efficient help from both the Reception and Prescription teams.  The practice works as a really effective team, and I am extremely grateful to you all.

title: Exceptional and Courteous Care
body: I had an operation at Moorfields eye Hospital a few weeks ago (my first operation and I'm in my 60's) and was astonished at the level of warmth, courtesy and kindness I received. It felt like being part of a large, friendly family. The energetic and efficient NHS team collaborated like clockwork, treating both their colleagues and  patients with humour and great attention to detail. They answered my endless questions thoughtfully and calmly and went out of their way to follow up on the successful operation with continuing concern and rigour. Thank you so much NHS - I'm very happy and can see better than at any time in my life.

title: Super Efficient
body:
I was so impressed with the service I received yesterday. The efficiency and care was outstanding. I spoke to a lovely receptionist who gave informed advice. I then was guided through a process ( including simple tests) where I later received a text asking me to pick up a prescription . The friendly pharmacy team sorted this out within ten minutes and the next day I am feeling so much better already. 
In such a difficult period it is only fair to review and thank the people who work so hard in such difficult circumstances . 
Teamwork and communication with a smile. Feeling very lucky to have this service locally. Keep up the good work. 
I very rarely write reviews for anything but I think that there is a need to recognise excellent service especially when staff are exhausted and morale is low.

title: Excellent service
body: I joined this practice 6 month ago after moving home. I submitted an e consultation at the weekend, within 24 working hours, my GP phoned me to discuss my symptoms and my request for treatment. A prescription was sent to the chemist, after discussing all the options available  and possible side effects.  Excellent, seemless service. Thank you, I can recommend this practice 100%.

title: First rate caring service
body: After getting concerned about an insect bite I rang 111 at 23.00. The consultant took time to establish that I needed urgent attention. An appointment was booked for me for a clinician to call me the following morning around 9. At 8.30 clinician ‘L’ rang me from Loughborough Urgent Care centre. She took time to discuss how I felt and the extent of the problem on my leg. An appointment at LUCC was arranged for 10.00. I arrived at 9.40, saw the triage nurse who was similarly friendly and caring and before 10.00 was speaking with clinician’L’. She was extremely thorough, took time to assess the medical problem and to advise a course of treatment. The service I have received today has been first class and I am so grateful to be able to get such good treatment from a caring team at a weekend. Thank you to all involved.

title: Improved practice
body:
Very noticeable difference in organisation of practice
Receptionists  polite and knowledgeable  called in on time  for my appointment

title: absolutely appaling GP Practice
body: I moved over from Seymour grove health centre my health has been great affected and not being able to see a gp or get an appointment this is why we have so many ill people as we cant get appointments disgraceful practice not been able to get online or ask my gp for 2 months

title: Prescription Fiasco
body: The surgery encourage you to request prescriptions online which I did two weeks ago.  Called into the pharmacy a week later - guess what no prescription. Emailed the surgery again to request this request is now actioned urgently. Called in at the pharmacy again today - still no prescription.  Two hours waiting on the phone to speak to a receptionist - she is going to ensure it is done today but I am not holding my breath.  Shockingly bad service before the inspection, I thought they might improve with supervision but in fact have got even worse.

title: Great Gp practice in Leeds
body: Excellent service, every one helpful, doctors, nurses, receptionist they try to help in their own ability. Sometime difficult to get Gp appointment but understand, emergency patients get more priority than ongoing health problem, but nurses appointments available even on the day...highly recommend this GP practice

title: Awesome
body: Came into hospital through A&E with a scary condition which affected my eyesight, swallowing and speech. My left eyelid and eyebrow had also dropped.  Within 24 hours I was diagnosed with myasthenia Gravis. Almost at the end of my stay now and must say that the response, knowledge, compassion and Efficiency of the doctors and staff was exemplary and would reassure anyone being admitted to ward 42  for this rare condition or similar, that they are in good hands and will get the best treatment there is.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Fab
body: Very prompt to deal with checking in. Covid safe. Gp excellent and informative. Pleased with the outcome and extremely through

title: Great practice
body: I love this doctors. I’ve been with them for over 20 years and my children are with them too. I have needed them, wanted their help and asked them questions. I can’t fault the service they provide here. If the doctor can’t answer me then they go away and come back to me. During covid I had to be seen in person quite urgently and they totally accommodated that. The doctors are fantastic. The receptionists have such a hard job and although not everyone appreciates them having to ask you for details so the doctor can triage you, I have no problems with that at all. I appreciate that if there are people more needy than me that they are prioritised. It’s all about you giving them all the correct information to be able to prioritise correctly. As for my children needing to see them, they have again been amazing. I feel very safe and in good hands from the beginning with the answer from reception through to seeing or more so speaking to the doctor on the phone. Would highly recommend

title: Best care and support you could get
body: Had 2 uni knees and I cannot praise the staff enough for caring and supporting me. They are 200% committed to caring for you and giving you the support when needed. I had a few wobbles and without them all I would not have got through it. They were all professional and polite. Thank you all.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Good telephone service
body: The admin team have dealt with a wide range of my problems since I experienced difficulty with booking my second covid jab in January, until my last call a few days ago. They have been unfailingly cheerful and polite and quick to call me back if something can’t be dealt with immediately. I admire their fortitude and resourcefulness.

title: Excellent experience
body: We were incredibly impressed at our experience at Croydon A&E this week. My husband attended to St George’s A&E twice this week with life-threatening condition. However, he had not been booked in but had been sent to see GP instead. GP doctors were unable identify how serious illness was and was sent home twice. The situation worsened at night and we went to Croydon A&E. My husband didn’t wait at all and received urgent care and treatment. Absolutely amazing team of doctors, nurses  and receptionist. We cannot thank you enough to all staff for excellent care and for saving my husband’s life. Thank you so much! ❤️❤️❤️

title: Very efficient
body: My request for emergency medication was dealt with expeditiously, a doctor telephoned within half an hour and a prescription was issues by text so that the emergency was dealt with in a very short time.

title: lovely staff
body: visited today for the walk in service. I was seen promptly by very friendly staff members, the gp was outstanding! super friendly, very gentle and took time and effort to explain and talk me through my problems, nothing we spoke about was a bother to her, it was the least rushed appointment I have ever had! Well done to this practise I wish there were more like you!

title: Horrendous.
body: 8 & half hour wait for an 18month old with breathing difficulties, snotty attitude from staff, actually wanting people to leave without seeing the doctor so they could take them of the list, absolutely horrendous & an embarrassment to the city of Liverpool & the NHS.

readBy.name: Alder Hey Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Alder Hey awful experience
body: Absolutely horrendous experience at alder hey this evening! What started off as a 5hr wait and increased consistently and is now an 8 and a half hour wait for my 18 month old who is suffering with breathing difficulties! Staff have been very unhelpful and rude to not only myself but other parents. When I asked for my daughters breathing to be assessed for a second time I was greeted with an eye roll as if it was an inconvenience. Absolutely not good enough! Completely disgusted with how myself and my daughter have been treated!

readBy.name: Alder Hey Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unable to call back
body: Having tried to get an appointment 3 times and been fobbed of with a call back the doctor has failed to do so.  Having rarely needed the assistance of our NHS I am not supported it is being privatised. Total shambles. I have now resorted to going to A and E with neither an accident or emergency. The lack of response from this surgery forces the use a valuable abs overstretched capability. Shame on you Avon Valley Practice.

title: Excellent service
body: Extremely professional and friendly service. Staff, premises and treatment could not be faulted. Everyone from the porters to the reception staff, nurses and surgeons were helpful, friendly and excellent at their jobs. Reassuring on operation day, efficient treatment with great result.

title: Appalling  care
body:
My Mum recently  spent 9 nights on ward B14 , she was put in a side ward & left,  the nursing care was very poor apart from a couple of lovely nurses. She had 2 altercations with night staff , rudeness, lack of respect & care, she wouldn't treat an animal the way she was treated. Only saw he named Dr twice , promised her he would get her mobile & pain free, she went in with severe back pain & immobility . He never did anything to help her at all , broken promises. We had her transferred back to QEH  Kings Lynn. 
She was totally  isolated & nobody popped in to see how she was . I had to call to check all the time , trying to get last the ward clerk on the phone was difficult.  Lovely clean hospital shame about the lack of care , some Nurses shouldn't  be in that profession.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Home Alone
body:
I was taken to the Hospital and got to say the staff are extremely nice, was taken care of, but I was released and told my care would be in the community.

the Doctor used the old, if you broke your arm, you would be bandaged in hospital but the healing would be done at home, so home i was sent.

I have to say I feel considerable lied to the as I was given nothing nothing that would resemble anything that could be considered to a bandage, and I have been home for nearly 3 months and all I have had is several phone calls 2 from a CPN saying she didn't want me on her books and an OT ask me questions, so the healing in the community is none excitant, I feel more depressed and mental health unwell than I did before I was taken in as I was told I would be helped in the community which hasn't happened and now I just feel worthless, as I've been made to feel like I wasn't worth their time, now I'm not worth the community time either.

 so BIG thanks..

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Bad experience
body: Was surprised by the lack of sympathy. When i arrived the nurse was cold and seemed annoyed to be dealing with me. Tried explaining the situation of why i arrived late by a few minutes and was instantly told to leave the building. Prior to this i had two appointments cancelled because of issues with the nurses and miscommunication which i completely understand especially with the current situation even though i had to make the journey for one of them because i wasn't told about the change of appointment beforehand through any ways of contact.  The way the situation was handled was disappointing to say the least.

title: Emergency is not really emergency here
body:
We can understand the current situation! However, even before the pandemic also we had the similar experience! 

What we can suggest is, at least you can inform how much time it would take to see the doctor and explain the process clearly. After the X-ray done for my daughter, we were waiting for hours and hours without knowing when we would be called, though we can see very few kids were there in the room..  

No one wants to get emergency, but the situation becomes worst with your current  approach!! Seriously, you have to consider a better way to help during emergencies!!

title: Increasingly Poor Practice
body:
This used to be a sound practice. Now within a year or two it has gone downhill.  
The processes  all seem to frustrate the patient. 
 Where once a medication review was done over the phone in a minute or two it now is prearranged on a specific day with no  firm time and thus the slot can be missed if you leaving you with no meds - irritating if you are reviewed four times a year by a hospital doctor.   
Doing e-consults aren’t ideal and when you chase up a prescription to wait 1 hour is ridiculous .  Woe betide you if there is an issue with a medication as you ll get nowhere. I seem to spend my life now chasing and emailing l.
There seems to be no alternative now but to go to A&E as it’s the only way to see a Dr.

This practice hasn’t changed much in terms of patient numbers over the past year or so but has spanking new offices and more people involved with increased technology . However, care is failing and with that, vulnerability and frustration increasing.  
If hospital consultants can reach out to their patients to keep in touch periodically why can’t GPS?

title: Poor communication
body: My Nan has been to WHH several times in the last few weeks, she is severely death to the point that the doctors and nurses are unable to communicate with her. The communication to the family has been abysmal. She went in with a fall and it wasnt until 10+ days until her family or her learned she was being treated with pneumonia despite visiting her every day and asking for updates...that's 1 example I have many more. Truly shocking! This is not a NHS we should be proud off

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent staff in a mess of a merger
body: I have to compliment the staff at reception Waiting A at Portland as I had an appoinment and text with it on, but was not booked on the computer, they explained they had issues with the merger and computers, but they were friendly, calm and professional and managed to find a doctor to see me, then when I saw the doctor, it was one of the new ones from the merger and she was AMAZING and listened and has given me a diagnostis and referral to ENT after having infections for 9 months and just being given antibiotics. what an amazing service and a credit to the NHS

title: Poor infection control practice
body:
The consultation with the GP was very good. I found them compassionate and understanding and prepared to listen to my concerns.

However, I was concerned about what I observed with regards to the reception staff. They were not sitting 2 metres apart, one was wearing a mask under the chin and the other wasn't wearing a mask at all. All the patients and other staff were wearing masks correctly. It is a concern that as a provider of healthcare the staff on reception were not wearing masks correctly and setting an example to people using the service.

title: Absolutely brilliant
body:
I rang 111 at 8:44 this morning (Saturday) in severe discomfort from a bladder/ kidney infection.
My call was triaged very efficiently, I was told to expect a callback within 6 hours.
At 8:55 I got the promised call, nurse took further details and said I would need to speak to out of hours GP, expect a call within 6 hours.
10:34 I received the promised call from a very friendly GP,  a few questions and history taking and was asked if I would like a prescription sent to my nominated pharmacy, I said “yes, when would they receive it”.
“It’s there now” she said.
As my local Boots is only a short walk, my partner was there and back by 11am and the first dose was administered.

Less than 2 hours especially in this current crisis is unbelievably good, very very happy with the service I received 👍❤️

title: Outstanding service
body:
Appointment went to private imaging of which I left messages that I wanted it at the GUEST .. failure of private to even return my calls & their communication was incorrect. I contacted RHH, & the whole process was outstanding to get an appointment at the Guest. 
 Email received confirming arrived quickly, & the 2 members of staff i dealt with were EXCELLECT  friendly & helpful . THANK YOU DO MUCH 🌈

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful service at the Jasmine Centre
body: I was urgently referred and seen in 10 days. My appointment was on time and all aspects ran like clockwork. From being welcomed at reception to the doctor and all other staff (scanners, biopsy takers etc) I was treated with respect and kindness. I was lucky enough to not need further treatment following my tests but I would have had complete confidence in this centre to provide anything else that would have been necessary. Thank you, what a great job you’re doing!

title: Great practice and care
body: I was admitted to hospital with suspected stroke .Patience kindness and understanding the staff gave me during my stay in hospital will never be forgotten . Thank you so much especially Gosia healthcare assistant from A&E assessment unit for your wholehearted effort on doing the best you could to make my stay as comfortable as possible !!!

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Compassion and professionalism
body: On Monday 28 June 2021 I experienced a severe episode of angina. I was taken by ambulance to the RUH and subsequently needed angiogram angioplasty and a stent. From A&E, via Medical Short Stay, the Cath Lab and then CCU, I experienced a high quality of care, compassion and professionalism across the board from cleaners to consultants.  An excellent and life saving experience

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Out of hours service
body: My 5yr old daughter needed to be seen by out of hours service. All the NHS staff I spoke to and was seen by were amazing. The GP who saw my daughter was fantastic,put her at ease and myself. The service was fantastic and made me realise just how amazing our NHS staff are

title: Didn’t want to no
body: Rang to inform I had covid and was unwell just given a sick note had to get help from out of hours very bad service don’t even no  who my g p is won’t go to them again

title: Fantastic practice
body: I have been a patient at this practice for a number of years but have not really needed any help until I had my daughter 8 months ago. I have been so impressed with the care I have received since. The reception team are excellent; they always try to accommodate requests in a friendly and efficient manor. Just earlier this week, I was away and had no migraine medication, so they organised for a prescription to be sent to a pharmacy local to where I was staying and I had the medication within 2 hours. I was so relieved and grateful. My GP, is also outstanding. I have been impressed by the whole clinical team, and thanks to the admin and managerial team behind the scenes too. I am a GP myself and understand the pressure the practice must be under during the pandemic, with new ways of working, and this team are doing a fantastic job. You should all be very proud, many many thanks.

title: Lovely hospital
body:
This was my first experience of an operation and I found the staff to be polite and friendly.
The food was of excellent quality and the rooms were kept very clean and tidy.  I would definitely recommend this hospital to my family and friends.

title: Amazing staff all round, especially Daisy Unit
body: I was kept in overnight on the 9th July after gallbladder surgery, I would like to say a big thank you to all involved, particularly the day and night staff in the Daisy Unit. Although I was feeling very sick and sore all the staff in this unit were soo attentive and caring, which is always appreciated when you are feeling sick and vulnerable. Thank you all.

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Didn't call back
body: I was told a doctor would call back within the hour at 5.40pm, still no phone call at gone 11pm for a 6 month old baby. I rang to chase it up, to be told, sorry its busy, you'll have to wait. Not good enough.

title: Superb practice
body: I am extremely impressed by the safe, clean, efficient service provided from initial contact to post-op. Totally brilliant -thank you and I would recommend anybody and everybody to use you!

title: Great place
body: Called at 8 as soon as they opened they booked me in for a telephone appointment by 9oclock I had spoken to the doctor ans got the treatment I needed.. can’t fault them super quick and really helpful

title: Great Practice
body:
I’ve recently joined this doctor’s practice as my previous practice wasn’t great. 

The receptionists are friendly and helpful whenever I’ve called. 

The doctor that I’ve spoken to/seen has been brilliant. They’ve not ignored me, they’ve ordered tests, and they’ve been thorough. Whilst it often feels like a rarity these days, you can tell the doctor cares about their patients. Thoroughly impressed with them.

title: Visit to nurse
body: On my visit I was treated with extremely pleasant warmth, efficiency and professional expertise. A major asset to the surgery.

title: Excellent use of e-consult
body:
I used an NHS e-consult form to contact the surgery for a minor nagging problem of insect bites that wouldn’t heal properly.

I was given helpful advice and a prescription very promptly and kindly offering additional help if the condition does not improve.

I was impressed by the kind and prompt response written by the doctor at 8.00 pm in the evening.

Thank you Lakeside.

title: Absolutely brilliant!
body: Had my cataract op recently and cannot praise enough the staff and consultant for their excellent way of working. Friendly, caring, (especially to an old scaredy-cat like me!), and talked me through every part of the procedure. They had also done this operation for my husband last year and they were SO GOOD, which is why I opted to go to them. Glad I did! If you need this operation, go to wonderful Hayesbank!

title: Fab Doctor and nurse
body:
Review based on todays experience I attended the practice today Sunday - yes a Sunday !!!
The lady Dr explained everything that was going to happen and both her and the lovely nurse put me well at ease as I was a tad nervous.
I stumbled across this Dr a few months ago and she is an absolute diamond - very thorough and nothing is too much trouble.
Thanks again for this morning girls - job well done 🙌🏼

title: Above and beyond
body: I've recently received radioactive iodine treatment on Yeo ward and I want to say a huge "thank you" to the two nurses involved in my care, the nuclear physicist administering the treatment and nuclear medicine department conducting my scan. I was very apprehensive and anxious beforehand and the staff went above and beyond to relieve my fears and I will always be thankful. These staff members are a true credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Great service
body: I use the pharmacy in Uley on a monthly basis and find the staff and service to be first class. I just hope the GPs soon return. Thank you

title: Wonderful treatment
body: I went into hospital on Thursday with what turned out to be appendicitis.  The staff were all kind, gentle, efficient and effective.  They explained things carefully, they did all the right checks multiple times, they were kind, they did their best to keep me and other patients cheerful and they came very quickly when one of us needed help.  From the moment the paramedics collected me at home to the moment I left the hospital I felt I was in safe, capable and very caring hands. I hope to never require emergency surgery again in my life, but if I do, I will feel safe going back to Stoke Mandeville.

title: Wonderful staff
body: I was admitted with severe back pain and all the staff in the wards I was in were fantastic. A special mention to the staff on Huntsman 6 who looked after me so well

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Bad practice
body: No compassion or care given from this surgery. The doctors are very rude with bad manners. The receptionists are very unhelpful and have no time for the practice needs and like to argue. I wouldn’t recommend this surgery to anyone.

title: Poor practice
body: The staff in reception are rude and have no manners! They don't answer the phones and then say theres no appointments but they just sit and talk all day. The doctors just dont want to seen anyone anymore or you get fobbed off with go to nhs111!!!! Why would I come to you then! Sent a prescription last week and still hasnt been done I wonder what they do. Asked to speak to the manager and no surprise she wanst available either. Will not be staying here now! Had enough!

title: Rude nurses
body: I visited the urgent treatment centre yesterday and left in floods of tears by the way I was spoken to and cut off when I tried to speak. I was made to feel stupid and spoken down to that left me in utter shock. I felt like I was an inconvenience even though I was in pain and never once did I feel a caring nature from two of the staff I saw. I put it down to maybe just a bad day but there really was no excuse for reducing someone to tears who already felt rubbish. I never go to hospital for anything and probably won't choose to go again.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Visitors
body: I appreciate everything that is being done to keep patients and staff safe and the hospital is doing a great job. At present I am only able to book one visiting slot for one hour which I understand. However, when I visited my partner yesterday there was another slot still available immediately after my slot had ended. I asked the nurse if I could take that slot as well but I was told No. To me this makes no sense as I am already there and it is basically a wasted slot that I could have used to be with my partner who has just had major surgery. More time with my partner would have helped him tremendously.

title: No call back
body: I’m 16 weeks pregnant, suffering with terrible morning sickness. I cannot keep down my anti sickness meds, experienced vomiting and diarrhoea and even vomited some blood. After struggling for days and feeling weak and losing weight I contacted 111 to be told I’d get the call back that day, hopefully within 6 hours. 24 hours later and no call, I’m disgusted, this is my first pregnancy I’ve never felt more scared, weak, and alone, like nobody wants to help me.

title: Dreadful Practice
body:
I had a blood test beginning of May, which took a few weeks for them to inform me of the results. I was texted to ask to make an appt with doctor to discuss things. Well I have called numerous times, tried booking appt and also through patient access and failed all the time. I then completed the eConsult form online at end of June, and now we are nearly aaproaching middle of July and still no response. So when my next medication is due, I can bet you I am going to have trouble like always to get it and be told the same thing about booking an appointment. The receptionists are so rude it's a joke. They don't answer the phones or even the door bell when you arrive. Don't let me tell you how slow they walk. They even speak loud on phone that you can hear whatever they are saying to the next patient on the phone.
Please, please please, sort things!

title: Phone Call & Link
body:
I was called after some blood and urine tests. I was in a nutshell told over the phone that I had stage 3 Chronic Kidney Disease. I was further told the Doctor will send a link for me to look at.

The link contains generic information and was not specific to my diagnosis. There was no discussion of referral to a dietitian or specialist about how or what I'm specifically supposed to manage or monitor. No discussion of how this impacts my current medication and lifestyle or even I will require additional medication as a result of this diagnosis.

title: Consultant arrogant and uncaring.
body: Admitted with excruciating back pain from 111. Made to feel like I was wasting their time from the moment I walked through the door. The ST3 and agency nurse were good. The ED consultant however, dismissed my symptoms and concerns as trivial and suggested I spend a week in bed watching TV to get over it. When I raised concerns that I could not stand I was essentially told me to man up. I found the overall service appalling.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

author: football27
title: Experience in Hospital
body:
I came in to ward 8 not knowing exactly what was wrong. My gp referred me thinking it could’ve been my heart. But it wasn’t.  
I was happy my heart was ok. I’m waiting on another scan. I believe my problem is with my bowel but it is taking a while to get looked at , this may be partially my fault because I didn’t say anything. I’m hopeful that it will get resolved  
I was due to be discharged yesterday but I told the nurses about my symptoms and they kept me in.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

links.id: shouldnt be discharged if cause isnt found

author: cetusfc73
title: Access to reception
body:
I wish I had seen all the reviews for this practice and found a different one to register with. I have never experienced difficulties getting through to reception at previous practices, perhaps getting appointments but not to simply speak to reception.  
Over the last 3 months when calling for my newborn or me I can be waiting on hold to speak to someone for an extraordinarily long time. I have been first in the queue and it’ll still take them over 10 minutes to answer the phone. Previously I’ve been only 6th in the queue and waited to speak to someone for nearly an hour. The longest I waited was an hour and forty five minutes (as it was urgent) to then have them cancel the call. This was not at peak times 8.30 am / 2pm). It shouldn’t take this long to speak to someone.  
I can only assume that reception don’t man the phones in a normal way. I appreciate they may have other responsibilities in the practice but communication with patients is absolutely key and will put people off trying to see their doctor. Once you do get through I have found the person on reception helpful and polite but this service is just not good enough.  
I have only dealt with two of the doctors, one them really listened to my medical issues but the other had no bedside manner unfortunately. They still dealt with my problem but didn’t put me at ease or truly listen. My last contact with this doctor was they were going to discuss a particular issue with another colleague and come back to me. I never heard anything from him and it’s been a number of weeks. I would call again to follow up but can’t keep investing the time needed just to get through to someone.

author: kilobb53
title: Horrible CPN experience
body: Would like to start off with I had an appointment with my psychiatrist yesterday who realised my mental health wasn't great (they are very lovely, helpful and understanding) and advised my cpn to see me more frequently. I suffer with severe anxiety and depression, have just been appointed new cpn and just came out face to face appointment and am now more distressed, upset and my mental health has greatly suffered due to the appointment. I feel belittled, degraded, embarrassed and now suffer with even more guilt as I have a one year old. Throughout appointment which only lasted half an hour (I was 5 minutes late) I was repeatedly told that something wasn't fair on my child, when I was explaining how I was feeling. When I was explaining what I found difficult they said that's why it's called a challenge. I felt that they were very argumentative, and when I explained I didn't have 15 minutes to stop and do breathing exercises due to my toddler, they explained they had toddlers too. They asked about my concentration which I said wasn't great but they noted that I play the Nintendo switch, which made me feel the need to justify myself. Was giving no advice on how to deal with my depression or anxiety, was just told again that's why it's called a challenge and that we all have bad days.

author: ancm
title: Dose 1 Covid vaccine
body: I have blood disorders that were completely disregarded by the staff. I feel pressured into taking AZ, and I feel I was misled when I was made to believe it was either getting that one or none at all.

author: wednesday104
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Here to get a brain scan done
body:
I had suffered from a brain aneurysm recently and have been home for 3 weeks since. Unfortunately I have been developing some blurry vision, black dots in my vision and a headache since. I am here to get a brain scan done just to check everything is healing okay.  
Since attending A& E the staff have all been very nice and I feel 100% happy with the care they have gave me so far. I must say however at I currently have a drip in my arm but I am not fully aware what this is for so maybe more explanation when it comes to administering medication would be good.  
I also think if possible it would be good to have an estimated wait time on a board somewhere so you could have a rough idea how long you will be waiting and then could step outside if needed for some air or to make a call without the fear of missing your name being called.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: sungk44
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A Long Stay In Hospital
body:
I’ve been in between Daisy Hill and Craigavon for the past three months. I’m currently in Daisy Hill following my movement from HDU in Craigavon to HDU in Daisy Hill and now onto the Medical ward here in Daisy Hill. I had multiple organ failure and survived. I was on life support and then moved to 4 South in Craigavon. I was also in HDU for 20 days. The care I received in Craigavon was fantastic. The doctors and nurses were lovely. The same can be said of the nurses and HCA’s in Daisy Hill especially Dervla, Moria and Caroline. Jill in ICU in Craigavon was also brilliant when she was caring for me as were Niamh, Lucy and Wendy.  
The food is terrible though. Breakfast isn’t awful but the bread isn’t great, but lunch and dinner are awful.  
I have got on well with most of the nurses on the Medical ward in Daisy Hill but there have just been a couple instances where the attitude of the nurses hasn’t been great  
But overall I am grateful for the care I’ve received as the doctors and nurses have saved my life

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: wednesday106
title: My time on 4 North
body:
I was suffering from severe stomach pain over the weekend and called the out of hours doctor on a Sunday at 7pm but never got a call back. AT 2: 30am the pain was so bad I could not cope. I attended A& E and this was a bad and horrible experience as I was informed they were understaffed for the night duty, it was almost half the number of staff they would have during the day.  
I was then transferred from A& E up to here on 4 North and have since been told I have a gallbladder infection. The staff here are all great and is a big difference from casualty. Unfortunately for myself I haven't made much improvement and I would be in agony if it weren't for the drugs they are giving me.  
I have had 3 days of IV antibiotics and painkillers which are strong but don't seem to be doing the job. I also have a high temperature at the moment.  
If I could suggest an improvement it would be the flow of information from the doctors to myself as I have only been able to speak to them once since I have been here. there was a mistake with my scan which was accidentally booked as an outpatient instead of an inpatient for me. This then ended up delaying things which wasn't great.  
I feel like there was miscommunication from doctors to myself and I have no clue at times what is going on. I have noticed a difference in the nursing levels too of the permanent vs the temporary staff and this seems an inefficient way to run a ward. I feel today things are starting to get to me so being asked the question am I content with my care, today I am not. Again I feel like I hardly see the doctor

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: wednesday107
title: My time on 4 North
body:
The staff here on 4 North are so friendly and you couldn't ask for better. Some things I would note is at night time the understaffing has been dreadful, you could ask for something and need it urgently but not get it as all of the staff are swept off their feet.  
I think as well in terms of the medical team we need a lot more information from them. I find at times they say something and it could be the 3rd time they've said it or come across it that very day but it is my first time hearing it and I don't always understand what they mean and it would be great if it could be fully explained. It was be good to explain the positives and negatives of something and the if's or buts anyone has. I don't have any major criticism for CAH overall and also the food is excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: runningkk48
title: A lengthy experience
body:
I had a heart attack about a month ago and have a stent put in in Craigavon. I’m now in Daisy Hill as I wasn’t feeling great and upon investigation my white blood cell count was very high and my consultant was worried about there being a possible infection.  
The nurses on the ward are fantastic and are doing amazing. The team goes out of their way to help you.  
However I felt that the nurses who saw me in the emergency department had no empathy for me and they didn’t particularly care about how sick I was

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tonyboothe
title: Admitted to hospital with heart problems
body:
I was sent from Spilsby surgery to the Pilgrim Hospital via ambulance with heart issues. i was told following an ECG at the surgery that my heart beat was irregular. Was left inside the ambulance for over an hour before i was allowed into the hospital. waited over another hour before anyone came and spoke to me. I handed my blood work in which had been taken from me at the surgery when i arrived at the hospital. was told later they had lost it.  
later that evening i my bloods were taken again. and ECG was put on my body and a cannula was inserted into my arm. later that even i spoke to a nurse telling them my concerns and what is happening to me? was told the doctor would probably give me some medication to resolve my heart problem. later at 1 am a new doctor came on shift and told me i can go home.  
Was told nothing about my condition or what treatment i need or anything going forward? i contacted my surgery today to find out any information. nothing was on my records. doctors never came back to me with a reply. i’m laid in bed at the moment unsure what i am to do or allowed to do. i’m very concerned

author: violetpw88
title: Pains and bleeding
body:
I had to be rushed up by ambulance because I was having this pain and I was in agony they took me to Worcestershire Royal hospital they done my blood test and they said it was normal. They have been discharging me and gave me pain killers that doesn’t even work this is ridiculous sent me home whilst I was having pains in my belly as well as bleeding while I am pregnant.  
I felt like I needed them to support and help me with the treatment that I needed but they only gave me paracetamol to help when I told them it doesn’t work I didn’t have that help or the right treatment also they keep on saying that the tests is normal and positive now when I visited up there for my scan they said there weren’t nothing there so I got a bit confused the waiting time was unreal till the point I wanted to go home but I had the needle I. My arm so I couldn’t discharge myself but yet again I’m in so much agony keep going dizzy also they trying to say that my blood test results are 31 when I know that the other day they was ok but I’m getting told loads of different stories that I’m not happy about this

links.id: help people with the treatment they need

author: thesukh03
title: ENT service referral has not been processed
body: Exactly one year ago, I had my nose fractured and I went to the ENT service at Northwick Park Hospital.   They performed a closed reduction surgery, however they failed to properly align my nose to its normal state. They told me that I was supposed to get a further surgery done after a 8 month wait. I waited more than a year and I’ve constantly asked my registered GP surgery (Shakespeare Health Centre) to chase it up with them. They have tried for over a month now, but nobody from the ENT service has gotten back to my GP. This is absolutely pathetic. Somebody needs to intervene because Northwick Park Hospital have failed to deliver on the service they were supposed to provide for myself. I would appreciate if someone from the higher ups could try to reach this hospital practice, so that I could get some transparency on what is going on with regards to my nose treatment. It’s bad enough that myself and my GP practise have tried to reach them. However, this hospital practice seems to have a lot of problems with communicating to patients. It’s been exactly a year and I’m still waiting.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Fionnuala
title: Child in pediatrician ward level 6
body:
I was recently admitted to pediatrician ward daisy hill with my 5 month old son and service received from doctors and nurses was outstanding.  
My only concern was as mother of 3 children and my husband working and caring for other children at home, it was near impossible for him to come in to relieve me to go get something to eat and felt like I was discriminated against as wasn't breast feeding I wasn't entitled to a meal within hospital. I went full 24 hours with a bite to eat within hospital until I actually had to ask nurses would they mind watching my baby for 30 minutes until I went down town to get food and the staff is under enough pressure without having to sit with my baby.  
It is a distressing enough time to have child in hospital without trying worry where or when will I get my next meal to keep my energy up to care for my baby. It would leave it a lot easier if least one parent could get meal within hospital whilst child is admitted.  
Thank you for all NHS has done for me and my family just a simple breakfast lunch and dinner can make difference.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Sarah161996
title: Another waiting list?  - no surgeon !
body:
Came into Wishaw General hospital for an appointment. It was a complete waste of time and so unprofessional.  
To give you a bit of background I have a underbite. I’ve know this for years (when I was 12) and been thinking long and hard about getting surgery. Now for two years now I’ve wanted to go for surgery. I went to my dentist who referred me to the hospital to see about jaw surgery (this was January last year) of course after that we had the pandemic so services have been delayed. I got a letter in for an appointment for July 2021. The letter states how I will need x rays and this appointment will take up to 2 hours. When I came into the hospital at the ENT reception a receptionist had no mask on! Then when I got seen you were lucky I was only there for 10 minutes and was a check up! The consultant gave me information which I already knew about and said they have a major back log and not to mention there has been no surgeon since before the pandemic. So I’ve to get x rays and molds done which will take another year ! It’s beyond a joke! Another waiting list- seriously ! It’s not like at this stage I need a surgeon to put braces on me! This is really affecting my mental health I have a jaw which clicks, jaw pain, over lapped teeth which makes me feel self conscious - I don’t want to smile because of it. I feel like this was a complete waste of time and not to mention a risk of health if they wanted a check up and to talk about surgery they could do it on zoom! I know that the NHS is stretched out due to the pandemic. However, it’s not good enough when I’m suffering from pain day to day and mental health issues because of this.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: FinlayN
title: Overall a positive experience
body:
Our baby arrived 1 week ago, delivered at the RAH Labour Ward after a scheduled induction.  
Throughout the pregnancy we also received antenatal/post natal support from the Lochgilphead Maternity Unit. We had a number of midwifes allocated to us from LMU due to unforeseen circumstances relating to sickness absence and people leaving which resulted in a lack of consistency in care up until 33 weeks of pregnancy. This had quite a knock on effect being a first time mum (all the questions!) - having to explain situation multiple times, and a lack of structure, organisation (missed appointment at 31 weeks!) and no communication from 21 weeks until 33 weeks (coupled by no antenatal classes due to covid) contributed to an anxious time.  
However when care was taken by over by midwifes Brenda and Lorna at 33 weeks we could not of asked for more supportive, on the ball midwifes - who have gone over and above the duty of care - from 33 weeks to our postnatal discharge. We are so grateful to for their support, knowledge and reassurance during the pregnancy and the weeks thereafter. Both midwifes are highly skilled professionals and made our experience extremely positive and gave the tools we needed to prepare for labour.  
I was scheduled for an induction at the RAH last week due to a growth scan flagging that our baby's growth may be tailing off and I had had an episode of reduced movement. From being admitted to triage and then to Ward 31B for induction the process was very smooth - we felt properly informed to be able to make a choice on induction. My experience of being on Ward 31B (before and after birth) was extremely positive, the midwifes there are so caring and attentive. I would like to mention midwifes Dawn, Stacey and Robyn who supported me and provided first class care before and after my very quick labour.  
My labour in total lasted just over 1 hour after a third successful pessary! I started getting very strong contractions on the antenatal ward which resulted in a quick transfer to the labour ward. I had requested a VE on the antenatal ward but as the labour ward had requested I move down to room 2 quickly - it was decided that the staff on the labour ward would perform this. I was in quite a lot of pain and distress by the time I arrived in Room 2, however no VE was performed and I was told that I was 2CM dilated, which I couldn't understand due to the level of pain. However I was a first time mum and trusted that this was the case.  
Due to this fact I had requested an epidural asap to help me cope to which I was told that the anaesthetist was busy in the next room with another woman. My partner became increasingly agitated as I was becoming more in more in distress with the pain and the sister at the time would not communicate openly as to what the situation was with the epidural. It was as if we kept being palmed off for another "15 mins" as the anaesthetist was busy with "more important woman" who had been in labour for 4 hours. It was only when I suddenly got the urge to push that a proper VE was performed and I was told I was 10cm dilated and ready to go?!  
This lack of communication as to what stage of labour I was in and and attitude of the sister created additional anxiety and stress to what was already a very emotive time. It also mentally affected my ability to labour confidently as my body was clearly at a different stage to what I was being verbally told. I held back in the pushing phase having been told I was only 2cm which increased my pain massively. I felt that my partner was not listened to as he advocated for me to have some sort of pain relief and I was let down as a result of one sisters attitude and incompetency.  
During the pushing phase my partner was told by the sister that he was not allowed to film the birth and told to put his phone away- we have since been advised that this is allowed as long as midwifes are not filmed, however that moment has now passed. After the birth I was getting stitched for a second degree tear which was extremely painful but the sister thought it was appropriate to keep taking a cold tone and attitude with me to sit on my bum and not move (really difficult after just having given birth and now getting stitched).  
We cannot fault the second midwife who also assisted the birth and to be quite honest if it had just been her I think our experience would have been much more positive. She was brilliant and caring and really looked after the three of us after the birth and we give our thanks to her for this. It is a shame that one person's poor attitude, aggressive tone with my partner and coldness tainted the birth of our daughter. I would ask that they are given additional training with respect to communication, empathy, dealing with stressful situations and the way she treats the staff who assist her, it did not go unnoticed.  
Overall we feel that we had a positive experience with both the Lochgilphead and Paisley Maternity Units, there are huge unsung heroes in each of the services we used which include, midwives, auxiliaries, cleaners, security guards, paediatricians (Brian). However the lack of communication is something that I think clearly needs addressed and I hope this feedback is helpful in providing insight into my experience as a first time mum within the NHS.

author: StephenM
title: my mother
body:
My mother had had a stroke and has been diagnosed with terminal (because it took the nhs so long to diagnose her condition she was too weak to be operated on) bowel cancer. A big shock and distressing in itself. But we were promised there would be care and support over her last months and that seems to have disappeared.  
It feels like we have been left to our own devices and abandoned by the doctors and the nhs and when I phoned the Medical centre for help, this was confirmed to be true, a telephone consultation some way off in the future was the best they can do. I dont know if anyone cares because they wont speak to me but it seems not.

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Being alone when you have just had a new baby
body:
I wasn't too happy with the assessment unit. When I arrived I was told to sit in the car for over an hour. I phoned them and they said I just have to wait. I was concerned that I was in labour when I was meant to be having a C-section. They really didn't speak to me nicely at all. The hospital should employ people that are empathetic and polite on the phone for this job. I was panicking and they made it worse.  
The nurses in the delivery suite and on this ward are amazing. The doctors are really good too. They have kept me up to date on everything that is going on.  
It is really warm on this ward and we aren't allowed to open the windows. I am sweating a lot. We aren't allowed to bring in fans unfortunately.  
Unfortunately the food menu has changed from the last time I was here. It is a much shorter menu with not much of a variety. I understand that this may be because of the covid situation. The vegetable soup is nice.  
Visiting is a tough topic. I understand that sisters/brothers or grandparents etc aren't able to visit however, I think our partner should be able to stay with us especially when we need them. I had a section and am very sore. I have to ring the buzzer each time I need to move my baby etc whereas if my partner was here with me he could do this instead. It does get very lonely. It isn't nice being alone when you have just had a new baby.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Kind, caring and helpful staff
body: I have always found the staff here are highly professional and caring. I have been referred for a few things over the last year and have always been dealt with promptly. I just spoke to one lady on reception and she was able to help put me at ease and made me feel like she genuinely cared about me as a patient. I was taught by my mum "if you don't have something nice to say then don't say anything". In this case I can only sing the praises of this team.

title: Worst service
body: This is the worst gp i ever seen no body pick the phone u have to wait one hour for received call by them. And the main doctor is so stupid no helo no thanks just straight away hang up the phone

title: Dismal Practise. Officious Receptionist.
body:
Moved to Ruislip from Pinner, couple of years ago: The Medical Centre there was superb, efficient & well-organised.
Tried to Register at Wood Lane but the very Officious Receptionist would not accept my proof of ID, from HRMC  Tax letter, with my address, NI Number etc all on it! Dreadful start. But it just got worse, as a little while later, when I asked to see The Nurse- for ear syringing, the  very haughty Receptionist told me "We don't do that, You will have to pay privately" . I was made to feel that I should not have dared to ask for help.
Foolishly I then tried e-consult- and was "fobbed off" by the GP, who was 100% disinterested.
ANYWHERE else must be better than here!

title: Errr... An appointment would be great.
body: Whenever I've got an appointment treatment has generally been satisfactory, although telephone appointments don't really cut the mustard and some nurse practitioners need to work on their bedside manner. The main problem is trying to get ANY appointment. Unless you don't work, booking is impossible. You have two options: ring during the commute, or ring after your lunch hour. And even if you make time you'll be on hold for up to 30-40 minutes before getting cut off, ringing again and getting told all booked up try again tomorrow.

author: UrbanAngel
title: Second vaccination
body: My second vaccination was in a different place than my first vaccination. The hall in Oakley, Dunfermline, was well laid out and run. The markings were clear in it and I was sent to a table with a nurse. I thanked her for her hard work during covid and she said she remembers me from my first vaccination! It was the other side of town yet she remembered me thanking her. (Even though I wore a mask) It was lovely having that connection that the same nurse saw me twice. It’s lovely. Even though it was in a different place, she remembered me. I left feeling grateful for being vaccinated twice and by a nurse that was kind.

author: Honey bear
title: Iron infusion
body: I did and a message 30 mins ago. I just said staff friendly. All I would like to know is my drip machine said warning air bubble, I asked as I got a bit scared and nurse said it's ok the machine by passes that, so I guess that's ok. And I did want to ask but did not because staff busy why lady oposite me her iron infusion was black, mine was colour of prune juice. Just a general question.
